title: ORDO (journal)
text:
(English: "The Ordo Yearbook of Economic and Social Order", most commonly referred to as "Ordo Yearbook", or simply as "ORDO") is a <a href="peer%20review">peer-reviewed</a> <a href="academic%20journal">academic journal</a> established in 1948 by the German economists <a href="Walter%20Eucken">Walter Eucken</a> and <a href="Franz%20B%C3%B6hm">Franz Böhm</a>. The journal focuses on the economic and political institutions governing modern society.
History.
The term <a href="ordoliberalism">ordoliberalism</a> was coined echoing the journal's title. Furthermore, the concept of <a href="social%20market%20economy">social market economy</a>, being the main <a href="Economic%20system">economic model</a> used in <a href="Western%20Europe">Western</a> and <a href="Northern%20Europe">Northern Europe</a> during and after the <a href="Cold%20War">Cold War</a> era, has been developed nearly exclusively within "ORDO".
Today, the journal's mission is to provide a forum of debate for scholars of <a href="interdisciplinarity">diverse disciplines</a> such as <a href="economics">economics</a>, <a href="law">law</a>, <a href="political%20science">political science</a>, <a href="sociology">sociology</a>, and <a href="philosophy">philosophy</a>. "ORDO" is published annually. Articles are published either in German or in English. "ORDO" also contains <a href="book%20review">book review</a>s.
